column5: Hello tescos. i do hope you can help me  after contacting your store with a regards to a complaint I have been BO boobed. I am not happy I would like you to contact me back  as I m not having any job both with your store nor customer services.
Why do Tesco fruit squash drinks have so much salt in them?

I just went to the Tesco Express Petrol Store in Thornton Heath on London Road  Store is called the New Park Express Store.  I was browsing the paper  just to check all the supplements are there.  Secuirty guard approached me and become very abusive!  I was shocked at the way I as spoken too and the way I was treated.  I have shopped at this store of years  all the staff are friendly and nice.  I asked to speak to the Manager and asked his name.  The security guard became very aggressive and refused to disclose either.  My 15 year old nephew was with me as well and had to watch this and also the security guard said that  I stinked  as well in th whole store which was deeply embarrasing and humilating.   I am a Tesco Shareholder and also worked with Tesco directors in a professional capacity.   If this is the way Tesco treats its customers then I am taking my custom elsewhere and I a complaint email is on its way to Dave Lewis!

I would just like to take some time to comment on the excellent customer service i recieve by your customer delivery drivers in the craigavon extra store they are all very well mannered. there is one in particular who really does go the extra mile   if i could pick a delivery driver it would be him all the time his name is Aaron you should be so lucky to have him a real ray of sunshine...

So I rung up your customer services as my daughter found a black hair (we all have blonde/light brown hair) in one of your bakery cookies baring in mind she had already eaten some  the hair was embedded into the cookie it was disgusting I was given an apology and offered a gift card as a goodwill gesture  this was over a week ago I still haven t recieved anything  I m really disappointed and I think your staff need teaching how to put hair nets on correctly .

Hi  I just wanted to pass on my thanks to Andy the delivery driver who delivered to us in our holiday cottage near Mold on Friday evening. He went out of his way to make sure we got our groceries following a comedy of errors on our part  and I m sure he must have spent more than our allotted time on us. Yet  despite us inconveniencing him  he was cheerful  helpful and professional; he s a credit to Tesco.  We truly appreciate his efforts  thank you.

Well done to tesco Kingsway dundee. This morning me  my hubby & our 3 yr old granddaughter went there to do our weekly good shop. Trolley stacked  we got quickly through checkout  very friendly guy on our checkout. He told us how much we were due.....I don t bring a purse when hubby is with me & his wallet was in his other jacket at home. Not a problem! Another friendly member of staff took our shopping. Stored our chilled items in chilled area til hubby got back with wallet. Excellent service! Thank you so much.

I was in Tesco Greystones this evening and it wasn t a good experience.  The car park was an obstacle course with trollies parked across the roadway in four different parts of the car park.  When I went into the shop the manager didn t reply to the PA system  I was left standing for nearly 5 minutes.  When I did eventually speak to her she laughed - not very professional.  The shop was messy and dirty  do you really expect people to shop there?  I know I wont be going back.

My children have been using your flushable and biodegradable  toddler wipes for the three years we have lived in our house. Today I had to call in a plumber as there has been a smell of sewage in my house for a couple of weeks. They took up the floor at the back of my house and found such a bad blockage that there was sewerage leaking out of the cavities in my walls and about a foot of stagnant water under my floorboards. When they pulled up the manhole cover it was absolutely stuffed with biodegradable wipes.  They told me that the flushable wipes we have been using should never be flushed down the toilet as they do not break down as advertised.   It has been a very expensive and stressful day  and apparently this is a very common problem that they see all the time. I would appreciate it if you could consider changing the misleading information on the packaging of your  flushable  toddler wipes.

Thank you tesco for selling me fresh pastry 12 days past it s use by date. This happened over a week ago I returned the item to the store and they could not even  be bothered to contact me to even apologise.

Thank you Tesco Technology.  Just had the most amazing bargain on a usb cabel for recharging my phone.  Even more amazing is that my phone is not knackered.  Thanks to the new USB cable my phone lives another day.  The smallest of things mean such a lot sometimes.   And it was after 6pm on a Saturday when all the cheap and nasty shops are shut!  I am a Happy Customer Today.

Don t understand how I m paying ¬£12 a month for Tesco phone insurance to receive either a brand new phone or (as I ended up receiving) a refurbished iPhone with no box  no charger or anything. Explain how you can justify the same change for these two different types of conditions?    Waste of time  I certainly won t be taking out insurance with you again.

Hi I purchased two Xbox games in store today and we got them home to find we can t play them because the game doesn t actually get released till 03/05/2016. Normally the game cannot be purchased before the game release date. Think you have made a big error !!!
Huge thank you to the staff at the Abbeydale Sheffield Petrol Station for looking after me when I stupidly put unleaded in my diesel car. Absolutely brilliant customer service!

Just got to say!!  Went in to Salford Tesco to buy an iron and some vitamins. The checkout operator was struggling and shouted the supervisor 6 times who was just chatting to a colleague. I left without ¬£50 of shopping as the supervisor couldn t be bothered to help! Absolutely disgusting service!

--serious safety issue-- Hey tesco  you really need to sort your junction out to the main road at the super store in Hollington. The road is extremely slippery in the wet  no grip what so ever  the surface is so flat it even has a shine to it. I Applied my breaks going down hill to the junction and my motorcycle slipped away from underneath me and I ve seriously hurt my leg!  So many cars struggle for grip on that piece of road  you seriously need to address this as it s a major safety issue. If someone stepped out in front of a car crossing the road there is no way a car could stop in time.
Paid for a delivery on Saturday  no items and no refund for at least 3 weeks - defintely not buying from Tesco again. Argos here I come!

Absolutely useless  have a faulty PlayStation 4 which was purchased from you and I m having to do the leg work with regards to a report  parameters and goal posts constantly being moved. I just want it sorting put after speaking to 5 different people all with contrasting information I m no nearer a solution

my father would like to thank tesco s with there new move on tesco s clubcard boost he is very happy that he is now getting FAR LESS value then he did before as NONE of your replaceing it with isin any way any good to him.  so he would like to say thank you for showing how LITTLE you actully care about your customer s.
Hi Can I ask why the Glossop branch no longer stocks Worcester Sauce crisps?
Fake vouchers doing its rounds again. Celebrating your 140th birthday  pretty impressive as are tesco not only 97yrs old

My 2 year old niece loves Paw Patrol and so became very excited when I said she could have some Paw Patrol socks in your Redditch store... She picked them up and looked around at which point she looked at me with tears in eyes saying  I can t have Paw Patrol socks they re with boys clothes ... Paw Patrol is for all children so not sure why your clothes are designed just  for boys  as designated in your store leaving a little girl a little confused saying she can t like Paw Patrol any more because  it s just for boys  üò™

What the hell is wrong with your website all i wanna do is order but it will not let me order   didnt know you were doing so well that you didnt need anyones money!! Fed up of keep repeating the steps over and over!

I was shopping in our local store catterick garrison  when my 4 year old hurt herself on the trolley we was using! She cut her thumb really bad. Amanda was on a till when I was frantically running past the tills panicking because my daughter thumb was pouring blood out!  She was amazing from the minute she noticed something was up  calmed my daughter down and also me  I must admit I was also in tears. What an amazing lady! I hope she gets recognised for her efforts throughout the incident! You should be proud to have such an amazing member of staff! Thanks again!

I ordered a dvd on 23/4/16 from Tesco direct ....received email on 25/4/16 to say it had been despatched and I should be in receipt by 29/3/16...I still haven t received my order and am very disappointed...I have tried to look on website for answers but just keep going round in circles . Can you help please?

I have just visited my local store at cannon park coventry and had a very lovely lady offer me some  community help  funding towards my shop for the local nursery sensory supplies! This is an amazing idea and I will be getting some pictures of my children enjoying the supplies I got with you today.... we can not thank you enough and after meeting Andy as well (trainee manager) I m sure he will do a fabulous job and I will be looking for him the next time we need sensory or science supplies! Big thank you tesco and a huge well done for your help!

I salute you guys! I work for Tesco myself and decided that after a long nine hour shift I would use click & collect shopping and grab it after work. But accidentally forgot a few bags of shopping. Head office contacted the store and Ian arranged delivery of my items. What great customer service. üòÉ.. I m proud ü§òüèº
Hello there     I m trying to find out when my local Tesco (Jubilee Way South  Mansfield) will be supporting contactless Payments?
Interestingly a fresh cream eclair frozen in the middle...
Hi  we have a Hudl 2 that unfortunately has a broken screen. Is this able to be repaired at all?

Just want to thank staff at tescos express great Victoria street Belfast ... Went in to buy plaster cos I cut my finger... They had none but gave me one out of their first aid kit.... Went the extra mile.... Thanks guys!

Hello! I m just doing my online shopping and I wanted to buy the dairy free chocolate buttons in milk and white chocolate but i can t seem to find them?! I hope you haven t stopped selling them because I struggle finding appropriate treats that are milk free for my nearly 3 year old and 1 year old girls!
This this is really ridiculous and un needed tesco for one little item all this packaging
Why won t the website complete a checkout currently?

Just wondered if you could help.  Today I was at Tesco in the precinct at Chesterfield  Derbyshire. As clumbsy as I am  I accidentally left my iPhone at the self checkout and left the store. However a good willed woman went out of her way to follow me out the store to give me my phone back.  It doesn t sound a lot but this woman has really made my day and has shown that there is some good hearted  honest people still out there. Yes  even in Chesterfield! It s a long shot but I want to try and find her so I can thank her again as I couldn t really stop and talk for long. This was around 2.30pm today (Saturday 30th April 2016).   If you re reading this  thanks again! It really means a lotüò¨üò¨
Hi Tesco üòÅüòÅ  Could you help me please with some research. On your own brand groceries  how is the nutritional information determined ?   Thanks in advance

How very strange that your alphabet candles are missing some of the letters. Wanted to spell my sisters name but found there was no  Y  Spoke to one of your staff members who said it was to stop rude words being spelt. With no  U  I could still find plenty of rude words to spell üòú
Won t be using Tesco hand car wash again  ¬£17 and I m going to have to vacuum it again.
Wondering what the singular of cress is?  Just bought an egg and cress sandwich from one of your stores... filled with egg and one strand of cress..... Egg was yummy though ;)

Cannot thank Abingdon Tesco and its staff enough.  We went today to do a bucket shake for Larkmead School in Abingdon to raise money to run a summer school for disadvantaged children.  As we walked in  we saw a wonderful tombola display that Tesco s had set up for us. Every penny raised today will go to our fund. I didn t know anything about it  but was overwhelmed. The sheer volume and quality of prizes were fantastic! The students and I have left now  but the wonderful team at Tesco s are going to carry on raising money for us and sell tombola tickets all afternoon. They are bringing whatever money they raise into school on Tuesday.  I am so grateful for the staff and Tesco s for being so generous with their prizes and with their staff s time and energy  raising this money for us.  Can t thank you all enough! We will smash our target!  As acts of kindness go  this one is brilliant!  Thanks so much! ‚Äî at ÔøºTesco Extra
Why don t Tesco sell the passion fruit  orange and lime muller light yoghurts

just been informed by a member of staff that it is illegal to buy more than two tubs of baby milk in one day.... i was trying to buy 3 tubs. please can someone tell me what law this member of staff was talking about as i am lost.

Shocked at how un-family friendly your stores are. After travelling to your store with my 7 week old daughter you can imagine my shock at being told you only had 1 trolley to accommodate a car seat. One of your larger stores and you have 1 trolley that I can use?! And why do you have 1? Because all the others broke. Such a big company  yet you can t even bother to ensure you have enough trolleys to accommodate your customers? How are people supposed to shop? Needless to say I ll be spending my ¬£100 elsewhere and I doubt I will return. What s the point in wasting my time travelling 15miles  and I ve still no shopping?! Absolutely appalling!!
We brought your pizzas for kids. Cheese and tomato... Just want to say thank you as my five year old refuses to eat pizzas but ate all of this! So thanks from a mum of a fussy eater ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Thanks to Wigan Tesco Extra. A mountain of toppings on my pizza! üòçüòçüòç
Is the ¬£70 Tesco voucher on Facebook a scam. I think it maybe.x

So we had a wonderful delivery man yesterday whose name I did not get but I got his van number and my order number. My other half was in on his own while I was out and was feeding our 3 month old baby when the driver knocked on the door with our delivery. He was nice enough to let my other half finish feeding the little one and then kindly helped bring the bags into the house and also gave my baby some wonderful attention. Really restores my faith in humanity and he was lovely. Thank you tesco!!

YESTERDAY S APPALLING SERVICE BY TESCO.......Mr Lewis   On 28th April 2016  I ordered a TV from your online site and I chose to have it delivered on the 29th April. I then arranged for a day s holiday from work and asked a TV engineer to come today to set up my Sky on the TV.  When completing my purchase  I forgot to add the ¬£20 discount  so I then ordered a second TV and . I then telephoned your support centre to cancel my first order and was told by your operative  she would cancel the second order and refund me the ¬£20. I asked her to ensure my delivery date was still today  she assured me it would be.  I called your support service this morning  to gain an update as to what time my delivery would arrive. I was told by a man  my delivery was delayed  he said it would not arrive until Monday. He said he could cancel my order and re-order to allow me to collect it from my local store. He said he would do this and call me once completed. After one hour and he had not called  I called your support centre again. (Meanwhile; I had raised a complaint online.) I was told by the second man  my TV would not arrive until Tuesday  due to the bank holiday. I asked why the first man had not called me and was told that due to my online complaint  he had been told not to arrange delivery to my local store. I then asked to speak with a manager as I could not believe  the way I  as a customer  was being treated.  A duty manager came on the line and told me  she would arrange delivery for tomorrow  30th April. I asked  who was going to pay the cancellation fee for the TV engineer and I was told that Tesco would not be responsible for this as it was not a legal matter.  I am now awaiting a call from the duty manager  to confirm my delivery tomorrow.  I am sending you this correspondence  as I feel you should be made aware of the way your committed customers are being treated and I would welcome your response.  During 2014  I had a similar online experience with your company and I swore then  I would never order from your site again. This is my first time  trying again and will absolutely  be my last.  Many thanks for taking the time to read my complaint.  Best   Catherine Murphy FCIPD

I would just like to point out the staff at Andover extra supermarket and the pfs are so rude!! Yesterday the lady at customer service didn t even give me a hello or goodbye  no interaction at all  and today I go in to the pfs and exactly the same thing no hello or goodbye  completely dis-interterested practically get my clubcard chucked back on the counter  at me with my items. I understand Retail  I manage a retail shop so I know the importance of customer service..  At a time with massive competition from discounters you would think as a company Tesco would teach customer service!

Hi if anyone from Tescos in Churchdown Gloucestershire hears of any weekend work going there please could you let me know as my 16 year old son is looking out for some weekend work and Tescos in Churchdown is less than 2 minutes walk from were he lives so would be a grate place for him to work .... Thankyou

We always have Tesco Everyday Value crunchy peanut butter at the weekend  it s a family favourite. However  we opened a new jar this morning and it was incredibly sweet  not how it normally tastes at all. My boys refused to eat it and me and my husband did but wish we hadn t. Has there been a production problem? Thsi si the first of 6 jars I bought at the same time so am a bit worried I ve just wasted a lot of money.

A huge shout of thanks goes to Alex of Dorchester Tesco.  Last night I went to get fuel & the pump for some reason wouldn t accept my debit card.  It was nearing 10pm to when it closed & he opened up a pump that he d locked so that I could get fuel  this pump wouldn t work for me either. At this point I was panicking as I didn t have enough fuel to get home :(  I scraped together ¬£4 in cash & Alex then used his own bank card so that I could get home.  This guy is an absolute credit to your store!!

Third strike Tesco. Third delivery in a row I have been over charged. Why do ye keep charging me for & sending out items I did not order. Yet again ‚Ç¨4.89 over. That is the third refund transaction that I will be charged for by my bank & all because Tesco are incompetent... Shame on ye! Order no 354194554
Can I ask why your stores persist in charging for carrier bags for raw meat when the law clearly states these are exempt?
Don t bother writing critical reviews on Tesco s web page - they only want positive things: no criticism allowed

I am fed up of incompetent personal shoppers getting my orders for home delivery wrong once i will take as a mistake however if 4 times ive ordered a joint of meet to be 1.8kg in weight ¬£10.80 ish  in money i don t expect a  Joint half the weight i order a weight for a reason    A ¬£5 good will voucher is a joke that doesnt cover the cost of  petrol and extra time i have to spend to go and get another joint of meat

The wife and I have always enjoyed Tesco Finest Moussaka  it s probably the best ready meal moussaka around. Anyway  after this week s home delivery we noticed the dreaded words  New Recipe  on the packaging. To sum up  what in gods name were you thinking!?!? It was amazing before; now it s just moussaka.  Maybe we re in a minority but I really don t care. Change the recipe back to the excellent one that wasn t runny  that wasn t missing the lovely cubes of halloumi on top  that tasted of genuine Greek food or I ll weld all your trolleys together.   (Ps I haven t got a welder) (Pps I can weld though)
Hi could you tell me if you are getting anymore of the RSPCA trading cards in pls x
This guys here nothing happening

Everyone is so quick to complain so im doing the opposite and praising some members of your Bishop Auckland staff and 2 male members of the public(In a silver car. Thank-you for staying with me asking how i was getting home etc) You have restored my faith in human nature!!! Unfortunately my car set on fire with me in it in your car park tonight. I was past myself at the time and obviously shook up but also highly embarrassed as a crowd had gathered to watch! The members of staff came over and although they couldn t do much just having them make sure i was ok etc was totally above and beyond their job role! Huge thanks to them all and well done tesco!

This evening a little after 8pm I was in your Birkdale Tesco Express in Southport.  An older gentleman who was frail and a little confused was being served at the til and had mistakenly brought coins that were a mix of UK coins and foreign tender  and therefore didn t have enough to pay for his shopping.  Carol  the staff member serving him  explained to him clearly what had happened and swiftly offered to personally pay for his shopping so he didn t have to worry about it. She didn t make a fuss  she just did it and told him not to worry although he insisted he d be in to pay her back tomorrow.  She was fantastic and deserves recognition for going above and beyond for this customer...this act of kindness has totally restored my faith in humanity x

Just wanted to write this as we are all very quick to complain and slow to praise. August last year I purchased a video baby monitor from Tesco direct. On Thursday it stopped working. I rang the Tesco help line and explained the problem and said i know longer had a receipt the helpful lady quickly looked up the order and found it. To cut a long story short. In about 20 hours I had a brand new replacement delivered to my door. This is brilliant customer service above and beyond what I was expecting give your self a well deserved slap on the back #Tesco. A lot of other company s could learn something here.

Hi.  I have just experienced my worst ever meal. Whilst I don t normally buy pre prepared food as I was going on holiday I thought an instant meal would be good.  I purchased some bourbon glazed ribs and some tesco coleslaw and potato salad. Even though I followed the instructions to the letter the meat was mainly fat and gristle. The bourbon sauce was chemical tasting and synthetic. The potatoes in the salad were undercooked and inedible and the coleslaw was tasteless.  Yet again Tesco hit the gutter with their food and every time I give them another chance their mediocrity stoops to an all time low. Before you ask I haven t kept the packaging as it s now in my bin underneath the foul food I foolishly spent my money on. When is tesco going to actually put some muscle behind the customer journey and stop expecting their customers to follow them like sheep. Is this why aldi and lidl are beating you? I am old enough to remember when the Tesco promise was  pile it high sell it cheap   nothing has changed.  You clearly employ the unemployable and provide little training and most of your employees see it as a job and not a vocation or a career. Hang your head in shame Tesco

I m a Mum to 3 boys and after the school run tonight I visited my local Tesco Extra Coulby Newham and a kind Tesco colleague called Ian helped me locate a double seater trolley for my 3 year old and 9 month old. He was so kind and showed me how it was escalator safe and even demonstrated that it had a break.  On exiting the store once I had completed my shopping I seen the kind Manama thanked him once again. It was hale stoning and he came to my car and waited whilst I put each child in the car seat then helped me put my shopping in my car boot before he said he would take the trolley back. Please can you thank Ian as he went above and beyond and his customer service/help was greatly appreciated! üëåüòÄ

Hi i shop at tesco all the time and use the cafe i have never thought ought bad about it untill recently when me and my sister went for a drink she ordered a small hot chocolate and i got mango passionfruit things it took us over 25 minutes to get our drinks.. There was only one person serving so it wasnt his fault they was clearly under staff not only that but my sister went up to the till to ask him something when another staff member came up to ask the bloke if he wanyed to go out on a break for a fag with her.. sorry but thats not right...
Chaotic queue in forest Rd Tesco as usual

The quality of the Greenville crop is poor you should have not left Kent potato company  stranded and and left 400 people out of work before Christmas at lest Tesco and Tata have something. In common and not expecting the hard worker
I ve just changed supermarkets because we ve moved. I ve noticed your own brand products are all full of palm oil  far more than sainsburys   Why?

I have to write to say a big thanks to Tescos Redding for helping us out earlier. Our son  who is 15 months was really sick at the checkout and the staff were absolutely fantastic. They could not have been more helpful and one lady in particular was so kind. She brought us some fresh clothes and wipes as our son was absolutely covered.  We didn t have a chance to get her name so I hope she manages to see this - Thank you so much  that was so appreciated!! üíê üí´

Just had a letter to say that Tesco are discontinuing Club card Boost. That s the final nail in the coffin. No point in paying Tesco s high prices anymore. Aldi you have just gained an another shopper. And Tesco wonder why there market share is dropping! Talk about short sighted. Good bye Tesco  hello cheaper  better value Aldi.

Hi tesco  I just wanted to share my disappointment in some haddock I purchased from the fish counter at your Duloch Dunfermline store today. The occasional bone in a filet of fish is to be expected  however  I m not exaggerating when I say there were several bones in each and every mouthful. This has ruined my husbands and I s dinner and I m just glad I didn t serve it to my children üòï

Dear Tesco.  Please help me. I m so sad :(. Today one of your wonderful shopping fairies brought me my shopping as is tradition on a Friday morning.  Now I had ordered as a treat some scrummy ice cream. Imagine my disappointment when my delivery fairy told me that it had fell out of his truck and been run over by a bus. I therefore when out later on with my children popped in to my local Tesco to see if I could pick some up.  Hooray they had ice cream but booo it wasn t on offer so I had to pay double what I would have if it hadn t met with such a tragic end. Please Tesco can I have my happy ending and live happily ever after?
Hello  when are the next clubcard vouchers due please?
Excellent service today in your Liverpool bold street express deputy manager was really helpful also the security guard helped me to some products thanks again Tesco

Well done Tesco I hear from greenpeace that if John West doesn t clean up their fish catching act you will clear your shelves of Jon West it warms my heart to know you care.so on behalf of all us out there who are faithful shoppers and all us out there who care about fish and the ocean  Thankyou

Just an update Tesco. If they aren t moved by tomorrow they will be disposed of. I can t keep them for you longer then that. Shame your customers wont see some of the great offers you have on for this bank holiday. Did find this situation amusing but how they are just in the way.

Cheers boys and girls.  Having gone up to the massive shed of yours in Mansfield Oak Tree for a spot of retail relief  the three specific items I went out of my way to get there were all unavailable.  Got the rest of the stuff on the list  and a tad more  but.......  I m missing my Cofresh spicy peanuts!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I wanted to ask about the vegan cheese you stock - your own branded varieties  made by Bute Island Foods.  Do you plan to continue these  or are they being phased out? Went into my local Tesco store today to get some  and they no longer stock it - really disappointing  it was great cheese!  When I asked if they still stocked their vegan cheese  staff members thought I was talking about  lactofree   which isn t vegan at all :/

I would just like to highlight some excellent customer services today. I am a scouter and was shopping for a camp this weekend with two other scouters. Two of us had our toddlers with us. My own child after shopping for 2 hours was very irritable and tired and the young guy Matthew on the till instead of shying away which is what we usually get when he s like that was more than friendly. He got my child round beside him to help scan through the shopping making him feel very important. As a parent who knows how easy it is to get stressed and emotional whilst shopping with a toddler just wanted to say a huge heartfelt thank you. Your kindness to my son did not go unnoticed ‚ò∫

You may have a long way to go in terms of sustainability and ethically sourced own brand products  but your customer service department is fabulous. Thank you for my ¬£10 good will voucher in lieu of soiled goods in my home delivery.
hi can you teel me please are your hot takeaway curries gluten free please ray

Thankyou for embarrassing me in one of your stores today. Im a disabled driver with a blue badge and have the right to park in your disabled bay and do my shopping but as I walked off away from my car I noticed one of your staff talking to a car and saw that staff member take down my registration number It looked like I was getting booked! He didn t even look to see if I had a badge! Then I had to deal with your staff calling my registration number over the mic to find out it was due to where I was parked and had to explain myself twice to your staff members and one of them wanted me to go back outside and get the staff member that had done my car. I said no you ll have to go and get them iv got a walking disability. So had to explain my spinal condition to them twice! I was so embarrassed I didn t even get an apology!  I have autism to so was highly embarrassed. An apology would of been nice when I hadn t done anything wrong! Not all disabilities are visible these days!

I spoke to people at your company the other day about some mis placed leaflets bit no one has sorted it out. Please can you give me a solution. I will be travelling in a days time so they need to be moved.
Once again utterly disorganised for click n collect

Thanks to the staff at your new Bicester store today  My son fell asleep in the car trolly and I was offered assistance with my shopping and for someone to get me a different trolly.  Whilst I didn t take them up on the offer as I had almost finished it was very much appreciated.  It s the first time we ve been  able to use one of these as they are always busy but it was a big hit with my 2 year old and until he fell asleep made his shopping trip fun üòäüëç

What have you done to your tesco lives ultra nappies??!! They used to be perfect  perfect fit  no leaks etc. I have used them since my little one was born and had no problems  now they leak after not being that wet and leave the crystal gel bits on her skin. They are also a poorer fit. Scrolling through I see many parents have the same issue!! Surely you should be listening to the parents who were loyal to these nappies and change them back  why fix something which wasn t broken?! Not a happy customer üò°

I am writing to complain about the quality of your new nappies. I have used tesco nappies for 4 years as found them better than other brands  however my son has woken up 4 times recently absolutely soaked through. The changes have not been positive! Time to find new nappies  very disappointing!

Just to give a shout out to the lovely Tesco employee at the Tesco extra on Queen Margaret drive in Glasgow  who stopped the traffic to help a very elderly gentleman across the road this morning  as he would have been waiting a while to get the chance otherwise  never been more happy to wait in the car  brightened up our day to see such a nice act of kindness!!!
Lovely happy lady in tesco littlehampton greeted us with a big smile and a banana for my 16th month old son to keep him busy. Thank you tesco I think it is it a lovely idea

I have just bought some fresh noodles and noticed the packaging has changed  from  a bag  to a plastic box. Has the weight changed too?  I think the bag had more in it . Can you tell me the difference in weights please?

Having heard so many good reviews from family and friends thought I d give it another go after not using the service for a few years..... Why did I bother?!  I placed an order last Tuesday morning (19th April) to be collected between 4pm-6pm. I went though the payment process and all went through fine. Got to the store at 4pm to pick up my shopping to be told my payment didn t go through because the card on my Tesco account was one I no longer used and hadn t realised as it all went through ok. I didn t have my bag with me as just rushed out thinking I was picking up shopping then rushing back to work. So had no means to pay. So I had to unload all the shopping I d just loaded out of my boot and was told I d be called later on. Which I wasn t. So I called customer service myself and spent time changing my address and going through the day s events and was offered ¬£5 voucher which I didn t think was helpful as I needed my shopping not ¬£5. I was then asked  what would you like me to do?  I wanted to make payment over the phone but was told that was possible so the gentlemen I spoke with tried to put me through to the bedford 1 store and no answer so again was told I d be called back but I m still waiting now over a week later!!   It s supposed to make your life easier and quicker but this wasn t the case with me. I completely understand that sometimes things don t go as smoothly as usual which is fine. However I do believe it s how a problem is dealt with. And this problem was not dealt with in any kind of manner I would expect so I will more than likely never use click and collect again for the pure headache it caused me.  I d like to know what would be the appropriate way to deal with this?

Dear tesco   I called in the 12th April to complain regarding the sourdough free bread in my local tesco express!  You have recently changed the recipe and the bread itself!! ¬£1.80 a loaf is a staggering amount for a load that is only 380g but unfortunately my other half is polish and can not stand English bread !!! Before the recipe change it was delicious and real sourdough now it s horrid!! The otter skin is different and the cut in the top is awful!! Before it has 3 small cuts now it has a huge cut down the middle which often cuts the roof of your mouth and makes it impossible to cut ! For the past 3 days I haven t been able to buy it due to the St Andreas fault line running dow the middle!!! I was originally told via your customer service that they would check in store re baking to make sure all was being cooked correctly as its a express store i know the staff and we have had many a conversation regarding the cooking process  I have even purchased frozen and cooked myself to check it and it s the bread not the store!  Can I also add the staff at the express have been fantastic and very helpful but I am now having to complain again !!! For the fact that the store offer nothing else as a alternative and ¬£1.80 a loaf is crazy I can easily do ¬£10 a week just on bread!! I was told yesterday that the supplier was meant to be writing to me but I have heard nothing and I am getting fed up I feel I am being brushed off!!!

I contacted your customer services department who told me that all meat purchased only ever has one day to use  if I wanted a longer  use by  for the meat I had to buy pre packed : / Offered a gesture voucher for ¬£20 which is worth less than I paid for the meat. Beware customers when buying from Tesco s meat counter  unless you are freezing it or eating all on the day you purchase  you are wasting your money!

Dear Tesco   I d just like to mention something to you about  the project bakery  within the Tesco store on the a217 in Surrey.   I asked my father to purchase some cookies from there on Monday as a super scrumptious treat for not feeling very well.  He got me the double chocolate and white chocolate bags of cookies.   I m very sad to say that these cookies did not live up to the usual high quality I have received from a Tesco cookie in frequent previous encounters.   They were dry and hard and I genuinely thought I was going to crack a tooth biting in to one of the White chocolate cookies at one point.   This is not what I expect from a Tesco cookie  or from any cookie for that matter that have been freshly baked. They should be soft and gooey.   To say I am bitterly disappointed is an understatement. As part of a family that has shopped at Tesco for as long as I can remember   I highly doubt I will be consuming your cookies or any other bakery good if this is what your stores deem as acceptable quality.   I do hope you take these points on board to avoid further customers being as deeply disappointed as I was with the bakery products.  Kind regards  Natasha

On a separate note  I was at a friends house last night  who was expecting her delivery order. It was late again (2nd time in 2 weeks!) - and when it arrived  the receipt which the driver left behind wasn t even hers. So we could tell you exactly what another customer had ordered. The name and address of a customer being handed to another? She then discovered that the biscuits she ordered had been unavailable  but no replacement sent. Given that my friend uses the delivery saver  I would suggest that maybe  again  people have been lured in to paying for this  but don t seem to be getting the service they are entitled to.  Seems like things are starting to unravel for Tesco at the moment. You need to get things sorted before you loose all your frequent customers.

This is Annette who works in Tesco Arthurs Quay in Limerick for the last 20 years. She s just 37 and is a wonderful mother & friend to all that know her. Unfortunately Annette was diagnosed with Cancer in 2014 & has been out of work battling this terrible disease with the hope of returning to work when she was well enough to do so.This was a real possibility for her until she recently received the devastating blow that her cancer is now secondary and is now battling again to try and beat this. The offer of redundancy has come up and Annette decided to take it only to be told the other day that she is not entitled to it as she is out sick. Tesco s should hang their heads in shame for doing this  to this young mother who at the moment is going through hell both emotionally and physically. Please Share her story. Thank you.

Dear Tescos   I don t normally do this but I just had to make a comment about how disgusted I was with one of employees at your Horton Lane Tesco Express.  Let me set the scene-  there was a child of no older than 10 who had been sent into store with a rather large shopping list  he d collected the items and was at the self checkout. He paid for his items and began to bag them. The women behind the desk who I failed to collect the name of kept giving him really stern looks. She then confronted him and said you haven t paid for those bags in a harsh manner. The CHILD started to panic and claimed he had to which her response was  well it s not on your receipt  so you haven t . So the child simple says  I thought I did but I ll pay again . By this point he has got himself into a bit of a flap and I can only imagine is panicking and starting to feel embarrassed as the queue is starting to grow. To which at this point the lady behind me said  is this really necessary ... And to be honest she had a point. Could the women not have just let it go for once. The lady kept on at him whilst he tried to rectify the mistake so I stepped in and said  don t worry poppet I ll pay for your bags with my shopping  you go . To which he very politely looked at me in shock and said  thank you very much .  Your employee then commented that  you shouldn t be doing that  you have no idea how many people don t pay for bags  I m only doing my job . This was said in quite an agressive/defensive tone. I appreciate she was only doing her job but as I pointed out  he was an innocent child . I did not like how she told me what I shouldn t be doing  at the end of the day it s my money and my right to spend it as I will and as a decent citizen I am aware of the choice I made in that moment. I believe this women should have taken the time to go over to him  look at the receipt with him and discuss it. He in no way showed aggression or was rude so he attitude was unnecessary  and quite frankly I d be proud to be the parent of such a well mannered child who is willing to correct his innocent mistake. I know you have to charge for bags but honestly he was a CHILD - what has this world come to for people to get aggressive over a carrier bag? It was only 10p - is your company not making profit targets that she had to be so pedantic over such a little amount. I believe and so did the women behind me that this was a genuine mistake on the child s behalf and did not need to be dealt with the way it had.  I trust you will take steps to talk to the store about this employee and look forward to your reply.  Regards Deanne Bates

So it s nearly midnight on a Sunday evening and I have yet again been woken up by the southwold  Bicester tesco express shop alarm! This is a JOKE and I have contacted you several times regarding this! Why should nearby residents be kept awake at night because your alarm goes off for no reason!

So Friday morning I went to tesco in paul street in cork to get provisions for work this was about 10.45 am on Friday the 22nd of april. As I was queueing at the self service checkouts I heard a woman in front of me in the queue saying that the staff member on duty at the self service check out had been shouting at an elderly man. I was thinking perhaps she misheard but then I witnessed the staff member shouting at this man simply because he was unable to work the machine. She kept shouting at him saying  I just told you how to do it and you did not listen  and  you ve paid for that twice now for god sake   Now I myself work in a retail environment and I would like to think tesco do not condone this behaviour amongst their staff. When I had finished paying for my shopping  the man had finished also and was talking to another woman who was as shocked as I was by the staff members behaviour. The man was shaking and when I asked him if he was ok he looked at me with tears in his eyes.  This is totally unacceptable. This woman needs taken in hand  she spoke to a harmless old man with such disrespect.  Others heard her and I hope they also contact you about this matter. I hope this will be looked into  Thank you

Hello Tesco   I find every time I shop at Tesco i feel like I m being conned. Meaning if i need the item in my delivery i have to get a more expensive item  pack sizes seem to get ever smaller on offer products as well  A major problem i recently had in your Cowley superstore was that i wanted some cooked chicken that was not reformed and was British for a reasonable price (lets say ¬£3 for 200g)  could not find this at all  went down the road to Lidl however and they had 200g of British non reformed chicken for ¬£1.99 and it tasted great  The quality of the cooked chicken i have had from Tesco recently has not been good at all  To me i look at the recent Financial constraints Tesco has been under and i wonder if the boardroom solution they have come up with to it is to try and sell substandard and poor quality goods at premium rates and therefore increase the profit margins for Tesco  I personally am not sure consumers will be fooled   Your disappointed consumer   OHJ

Been to your carlton superstore today and as I was paying at self serve I heard a woman getting quite distressed and emotional at the customer service desk. This lady I think suffers with some sort of mental and learning difficulties. She was very upset and shouting. The lady at customer services called sue really showed the woman comfort and support and mostly compassion and helped calmed the lady down. She took the time to talk to this woman while everyone else was staring. The lady said she had no family to turned to and I heard sue say you can always turn to us (tesco) This woman at your superstore is remarkable she didn t have to spend the time with the distressed lady but she did with a kind loving heart. I just want to thank you for hiring a remarkable woman  I worked with people with mental and physical disabilities and not many people cared for those like sue did today with that lady. This visit to your store just for a little shopping left me feeling happy and it filled my heart knowing there is still kind people out in the world today!

Just left the your appalling store on Lupus Str  Pimilco SW1.  I went in to buy two loaves of bread and some bananas. Stood in the queue for nearly ten minutes waiting to be served by the single checkout operator who was also tasked to sell scratch card lottery tickets as well as serving people buying groceries. I have no desire to use the self service terminals in this store as they are always going out of order.  In the end I left the queue and  like so many others who use this store - or rather try to  I dumped the basket  on the one of the many unmanned service areas and walked out and went else where for what i needed.  This is par for the course for this store and has been since the day the opened. The only alteration is that this store gets worse and worse with each passing month.  It s disgraceful the way this store is run and managed. Queues are allowed to back up right up to the far end of the store up to the freezer units creating not only a health and safety hazard but customer s stepping on each other s feet and bumping into each other trying to get past. My cousin was sadly diagnosed with Breast cancer 6 months ago  this then progressed and on Wednesday we were told the devastating news that she only had a few days to live.   Her two wishes were to marry her long term boyfriend and then to go home to die.   I believe the Marie Curie nurses contacted your Lincoln Tesco store (she was in the Lincoln County Hospital so I am presuming it was the closest one to it) to tell them of the situation and they had a wedding to organise    Tesco then took over and they organised an amazing buffet including bucks fizz  flowers  sandwiches  snacks  rolls  cakes and the most beautiful part was the personalised wedding cake  which had obviously had been hand written with beautiful icing flowers that were also hand made. This was then sent across to the hospital all within a few hours of hearing about the wedding taking place  and only 8 hours after she received the life shattering news  and all of this was done free of charge!   During the course of that awful day and night I can not tell you how much it made our family smile and praise Tesco for their kindness and the effort that went in. Nothing is going to cure my beautiful cousin  but in the face of such darkness  a company the size of Tesco stepped above and beyond and showed how much they cared  this one act will stay with me and my family for ever and I would be pleased if you could pass our thanks and appreciation to your wonderful team  you should be proud to have them in your team  I am certainly proud to tell this story  as the general public are very quick to criticise when a business gets it wrong but not quick enough to praise them when they get it right.

This probably won t reach anyone further than the staff member(s) assigned to take care of the social networking  but the big Thetford Tesco supermarket  manager  should be absolutely ashamed. My mother stopped by for a quick food shop accompanied by my brother and while walking through one of the vegetable produce isles she slipped and fell.   Why? Because there was so much rubbish (various veggies and mess) on the floor that she skidded with her walking stick and landed hard on her one good knee and the arm that supported her. She is -- and has been -- disabled for many years after Polio left her right leg practically unusable even with a caliper.   This is the first time she has ever had a fall in that Tesco s store and as a family we ve been visiting it for as long as I can remember so it gives a little bit of an impression how standards appear to have dropped.   I understand you can have a bad day  you can be short-staffed  you can have all the excuses in the world to make a mistake  but when my mum sat there with a cup of tea being looked after by one of the lovely staff members (sorry I have no idea who it was but my mum said she was so attentive and caring  and really appreciated her help)  the manager however  was busy on the phone to the claims line covering their backside and trying to play the whole situation down like it s nothing.   When a disabled lady slips and falls in your store because of your manager s negligence of hygiene and maintenance  then running off the claims line is the last thing that manager should be doing.   I doubt my mum will do anything other than spend the next week or so struggling just a little bit more now her already weakening body has taken another hit. She s more forgiving than most. I won t ignore that she was given the groceries (a few ready meals  condiments  and veggies probably totaling less than ¬£15) for free as a good will gesture too  which was nice because I know some some places wouldn t even bat an eyelid.   Hopefully this reads properly to those who see it  and the message gets across. Oh and if it gets deleted I ll be happy to post the backup copy across pretty much every social network possible.   To break it down  sort out the standards in your disgusting Thetford store and get a manager in there who actually gives a rats-a about their job and responsibilities.
Thanks Tesco for your speedy response to my message. Great customer service üòä

I don t normally post very much but I felt it is needed after the experience we have had with Tesco today. A few hours ago  after just having our hair done (my 13 year old daughter who is on spectrum and has dyspraxia as well as other disabilities and I) we popped into tesco.  I have been really ill since last July with acute bacterial bronchopneumonia (had it back 7 or 8 times and have had countless steroids and penicillin) and it was a treat to have our hair done as I have only been out 5 or 6 times since July. Anyway  I parked in a mother and child bay thinking it was a disabled bay.  As we got out of the car the man parked in the bay beside me said  you aren t meant to park there  and words to the effect that I had to move. I asked him why & he said  it s for children!   He was really getting quite rude and obnoxious.  I said I would move but said to him there was no need to be rude. He said  my wife is the manager at Tesco and she will tell you . The wife said  your  parking is over there!  Said in the same tone as the husband quite abruptly.  The husband then went on to say  we aren t allowed to park in  your  bays  I said OK  went to get back in my car and the man said  anyway  what is your disability  being fat .  This is an utterly disgusting thing to say and in front of my daughter.  This comes at a time when the dispatches program  which was on the other night  exposed one of their assessors bragging that he got paid ¬£20 000 a month to do assessments and all the other derogatory and inflamatory things that he said.  Genuine people that have disabilities are treated badly enough by the government  as it is  with the horrendous assessments we have to go through but you certainly do not want or indeed expect to have this type of abuse when you are just out and about minding your own business.  I was upset so I went to customer services in the Lowestoft Yarmouth store and a manager called Steve (that had been there since 2001) came to see me.  The lady on customer service practically had to almost beg him to come down and explained everything that had happened to him on the phone.  He said  what s the problem!   He said there wasn t much he could do because it s probably just a shopper!  Perhaps I could check CCTV but then I am not back in until tuesday etc  etc! This is how the conversation went until I asked my daughter  is it me or does he seem like he is not bothered about what had just happened? My daughter agreed and I then asked him why he didn t even want to take my name etc. In the end I just said don t bother and we walked out. I rang head office and first of all I was told that the child bay s are up to 5 years old as the bay s are for getting children out of the car safely. I said that I didn t know that but with a daughter on the autism spectrum (she is not road aware) and also falls so I have to hold her hand etc  then the bay s should also be for children like this. He went on to say that because it was a shopper saying what he said  there was nothing they could do! My daughter reminded me what the wife (the tesco manager) said and he then said that he would investigate!  I have been really upset all afternoon and so has my daughter and that is why I felt I had to post this.  Because the little weazle of a man wound his window up after he called me fat he might not have heard my reply so here it isn t!   One. You must be very proud of the example of a father  man and human being  that you are showing to your children. Two. I can lose weight but you are stuck with that face for the rest of your life! The way in which Tesco has handled this is utterly disgusting and the 2 poor excuses of human beings need to take a long hard look in the mirror and really think about what they did today in front of my 13 year old daughter. Please feel free to share this post and sorry it s so long. Thankyou (X-Tesco shopper)

I had intended to email you  but your contact form on your website only allows me 1000 characters.   My rant exceeds that limit.   I have just been told by Indesit that the washing machine I was expecting today can t be delivered because the driver has a bad back... seconds after I saw him drive off.   While I ve always been satisfied with the level of customer service Tesco has continuously given me over the years I feel Indesit have totally let you down today.   Here is a copy of the email I have sent to Indesit customer services:  Dear Indesit  RE: Order number 49GXQQW6G-1  After placing an order for a washing machine (plus free recycling) through Tesco directly on the phone and stating very clearly that I live in a block of flats  I have just been told that it‚Äôs not possible to get it today as the driver has a bad back.   I saw the truck pull up outside. A guy knocked on my door and said ‚ÄúI thought it was one flight of stairs  I‚Äôll have to go and speak to the driver‚Äù.   He went away and I watched the lorry drive off.   He then called me to say that  because it was 3 flights of stairs  they‚Äôd have to reschedule delivery.   I telephone your customer services only to be told that a traffic warden had moved them on.   My wife was standing on the balcony all the time the lorry was there. We have deliveries daily and never has a traffic warden moved on a delivery truck. That was the first blatant lie.   When I contested this I was then told that the delivery driver ‚Äúmay have been alone‚Äù  which wasn‚Äôt the case as the driver‚Äôs mate said to me that he was going to speak to the driver.  Then I was told that the delivery driver has hurt his back.  Did he hurt his back driving here? At what point did the guy who delivers washing machines for a living decide that his back was too poorly to deliver a washing machine today?  When he took one look at my stairs no doubt.  I now have to take more time off work on the hope that a guy with a good back can deliver it on Monday.  I‚Äôve decommissioned my old washing machine so can‚Äôt even get a wash on until then.   Absolutely pathetic service.   Don‚Äôt even bother apologising  it means nothing.   Regards   John Squirrell.  While I fully appreciate this out of your control I think someone needs to have a very stern word with that lazy delivery driver who couldn t be bothered to get my order up a few flights of stairs.

Hi Tesco. I‚Äôve tried contacting you via your website‚Äôs feedback form on Monday 17th April 2016 and unfortunately I have not received any feedback from your side be it from email or phone call. So  this is my next effort in getting in touch with you as I can‚Äôt get any solution from your Seremban 2 Store.  Below is the information I posted on your company‚Äôs website last Monday. I really seek your cooperation in settling this issue as soon as possible. Thank you. Hi and good day   I would like to bring your attention to a problem that I faced in Tesco Seremban 2 that have happened on two occasions: 20th Feb. 2016 and 21st Feb 2016. I have tried to settle this issue for almost 2 months with the store manager Muhammad Hafiz  but he has failed to help me resolve my problem.  20th Feb 2016: I shopped at your outlet and my total bill was RM522.95. I paid using debit card via current account. During the first attempt  the cashier claimed that the transaction was unsuccessful  and they tried it for the second time also claiming it was unsuccessful. For the third time  I asked the cashier to charge on to my saving account and the transaction was successful. Unfortunately  when I checked my bank statement  it was stated that 2 deductions amounting RM 522.95 per transaction were charged to my current accoount.  21st Feb 2016 I shopped again at your store and at 9.27am during payment  the same problem happened during my payment. The cashier claimed payment via current account from my debit card failed and then the card was swiped again for payment from saving account.  And again  when I checked my bank statement  there were two deductions for my purchase on the 21st. All this while  I contacted the store manager Mr Muhammad Hafiz and he has provided me email print outs regarding the conversation between S2 store and Jia Ying Lim. In one of the email  it stated that Tesco has already refunded on 23March. But  this is not true. I have not received any refund from your side. The total amount that should be refunded to me is RM1385.15. I have already contacted my bank - Maybank about this matter and they claimed that there is no communication from your side to refund my money. This problem has prolong for almost 2 months and this morning was the last straw as your store manager Mr Muhammad Hafiz claimed that the person in charge Jia Ying Lim has resigned and there s nothing else can be done to refund my money.  So  Tesco my question is: Is this how you treat your customer? Your loyal customer to be precise  as I shopped daily at Tesco S2 outlet Is Jia Ying Lim is the only person responsible on my money? Without this person  Tesco is malfuctioning? When can I get my money back. More than 1k has been ripped off from me for almost two months which can be used for my business.  I have all the original receipts  email communication print outs if your side is interested to settle this matter.Kindly give me the email address to send all the particulars. It is very embarrassing that this incident happened in a very large establishment as this can be prevented earlier during closing while printing the credit / debit card settlement report  because isn t it obvious that the total amount does not tally? I really hope that you can make the necessary actions to refund my money as soon as possible so that I do not need to take further action.  Thank you in advance for your kind and immediate response.  *Edited:  RM RM 522.95 was refunded to my account on 18th April.

Dear Tesco   My partner and I operate the Bae Seren B&B in Durness Sutherland NW Scotland. We live in a small remote community that is a very popular with tourists all year round and indeed is a regular stop off point on the North Coast 500 route a drive that has just been named most popular drive in the UK. I am very concerned that Tesco have decided to cease their click and collect service in the village for no apparent reason. The service is regularly used by locals not just the local business community and is often fully booked. With this in mind I cannot understand why you are stopping the service as the route that your service takes goes from Lairg to Wick via Kinlochbervie and subsequently has to pass through Durness anyway. I and many others in the community have been Tesco customers for many years and obviously we are feeling very let down by Tesco and your management. Is there any possibility for this decision to be reversed and if not can we at least have an honest explanation as to the reason behind your decision. If you are not prepared to provide an understandable reason I will have no choice but to inform all my visitors this year of the lack of caring that Tesco show to our community. In addition I will be in touch with the management of Asda in Tain to try and organise an alternative service.

Tesco - I was in today at Maryhill in Glasgow and i noticed chicken with the Halal logo on it.  To those that know about it  they would spot it but for the local shopper in Maryhill they would not know what the Halal logo is and what goes on with it.  I am not happy at all that you have decided to sell Halal meat/livestock products.  The process in which the animal goes through to be slaughtered is barbaric.  It causes so much pain and suffering.  I am sure you are fully aware of the process.  I would not wish this on ANY living thing.  I ask that you reconsider selling these Halal products to help cut out on animal cruelty.  I wish to hear back on this matter  as if it is something that will continue to happen  then I would be looking to take my custom else where.  I use Tesco not only for my food shopping but also Petrol station and Finance products.  It deeply offends me that Tesco would be willing to allow suffering to animals by putting them through this process.    I look forward to hearing a reply.  Thank You

Dear Tesco Home Delivery Service.  You suck!   We booked a home delivery for the 4th consecutive week..... Your driver couldn t find my house!  He had the postcode  he had the door number  He found the street  but not the house. The door has the house number on. The gate has the house number on. Each of the 3 wheelie bins has the number on and all 3 face the road (and they are day glow yellow)  Only a blind person could fail to spot the numbers on the house!  Yet your driver managed! I called at 9.54pm to find out if everything was OK as we were booked for a 9-10pm spot. I was told he couldn t find the house and he may be a new driver. The lady spoke to him and came back to say he was 4 miles away and would call me on the house phone shortly so I could talk him to my house.  I called back at 10.25pm again as the driver hadn t been in touch. The gentleman contacted the driver again  who now said he couldn t deliver as he was running late and didn t have time.  After some discussion it was decided that I would take my car to meet the delivery driver  who would call me in a few minutes to arrange where we could meet. I was given the drivers number incase he didn t call me (07xxx182679) I called several times from 10.55pm and didn t get an answer. Then I recived an email to advise my order had been cancelled and rescheduled for between 8pm and 9pm the following day.  Firstly   my street has 40-50 houses in and had been her for at least 50 years.  The postcode puts you to number 18 on a Tomtom which is just round the corner.  To find your way from number 18 you count the houses  or to be totally radical and think outside the box  you look at the doors for the NUMBERS!  It s suprisingly easy  taxi drivers  ambulances  police officers and various delivery drivers have managed to find the house without getting lost over the last 4 years I ve lived here!  But what s more frustrating then the incompetent driver not being able to find the house  it s the fact that 2 different members of your call centre team have out and out lied to me about the order  thus resulting in the order not being made and me spending 2 hours sat waiting for a delivery that was never going to happen!   You have now taken the money from my account for today s shopping (which will be refunded in 5 days or so) and you re going to collect more money tomorrow as the special offers we had selected ended today!!!!!  If your company is happy to accept drivers who can t find houses by looking at door numbers  and call centre workers who can t tell the truth I feel that it s maybe best if we part company  I m sorry  but as things stand next week I will be trying out ASDA S home delivery service.   I will add it s very much not me  it s YOU!

Just relating to you my experience with your home delivery service. I have already contacted your customer service team via online message and have received an almost duplicate reply as the previous week (although this was through a phone call). This does not fill me with confidence as to the possibility of an improvement. A bit of back ground I have been a loyal customer of yours for several years and spend in excess of 7K a year across your brands and have been using your home delivery service approaching 2 years. Below is a copy of my Messages for the past two weeks and the one typed reply (dated today) I have received.   I hope you can agree that this really does not make for good customer service and would appreciate another view point from Tescos.   My messages (the two I have copies of) Hi  I have just unpacked my delivery and once again I have items that do not meet your use by date promises. As follows: Clementines dated 14/4/16  Spring Onions 13/4/16 Crumpets 14/4/16 Last week I was promised that the store concerned would be informed and this would not happen again. Unfortunately things have gotten worse.  Additionally while the other items meet your use by date promises  I have only two products that actually exceed them. Whilst I appreciate that by their very nature fresh products have only short dates  I know by experience that longer dates would be available on most of them. Can I ask are you re pickers instructed to pick those items with the shortest date but that meet you re minimum promises?  I hope that you will be able to help with the above    Hi  As a follow on from last weeks feedback  this week all items are in date. But as last week  every single item matches the guaranteed days and apart from the dairy goods not a day more. I was assured last week that you would speak to the store as I was assured that the pickers should not be picking to only the shortest dates available. Today I was in a Tesco store and looked at the dates for the products. Apart from a couple of items (fresh fruit) the other items were available for longer dates then your minimum guarantees. So it is somewhat unbelievable that out of an entire shop not one product exceeded your given dates.  Unfortunately I shop on line to shop for the best I can for a week  with this situation recurring that is not possible. I will no longer be ordering fresh produce from yourselves and will stick to dry goods  and at the end of my delivery saver I will be looking for a alternative seller.   And Tescos reply. Thanks for your email. I‚Äôm responding on behalf of my colleague Russell  I hope you don‚Äôt mind. Firstly  I‚Äôm sorry if a number of items received as part of today‚Äôs online grocery order were at the minimum of our advised freshness guarantees. I can appreciate any disappointment this would cause  particularly if you contacted us last week with similar concerns about the dates that you‚Äôd received. Whilst I‚Äôm unsure as to which store you visited  I can advise that your orders are sent from our Dereham branch if you were unaware. Following on from my colleague‚Äôs report to the store last week  I‚Äôll be sure to address this with the Home Shopping Manager at Dereham in an effort to ensure that the pickers are offering the longest possible dates available to them at the time of picking as we would expect. Now it might be the case that you were offered the longest dates that they had but I‚Äôll happily raise this with the store and I‚Äôm hopeful that you‚Äôll notice an improvement going forwards. In conclusion  I appreciate you taking the time to get in touch but if you have any further queries  please don t hesitate to contact us at: online@tesco.co.uk.

I m sorry Tesco but you have been let down by the few. My partner and I were just in your Transit Way branch and I can honestly say we received the worst service we have ever experienced.   We went to a checkout that was empty and started putting our shopping on the conveyor. As we approached the till staff  we were completely ignored as he was having a light hearted conversation with another colleague that just kept coming over and standing near the checkout to chat with him. When I say we were ignored  what I actually mean is: - We were not greeted. - We were not asked if we had or required bags. - He just started scanning stuff and sliding it towards us (hadn t even made eye contact and was still in discussion with his colleague.) - We had to interrupt him to ask for a wine carrier (which he got out without saying a word to us but still chatting with his colleague.) - Once everything was scanned he just carried on chatting and my partner held her club card out to him waiting for him to respond. - He scanned it (still without speaking to us or even letting us how much the total was.) - My partner put her payment card in the machine without any clue of the total and not a word from the cashier.) - Once the transaction was completed  he handed us our receipt and said  cheers  whilst STILL not even looking at us and paying full attention to his colleague.  We picked up our shopping and left. I would have complained to the team leader/manager running the front end but unfortunately that was the colleague that our cashier was chatting to.  I personally was absolutely disgusted with the service and working in the public domain and in customer service myself  if I had seen a member of my staff act in that way it would not have gone unnoticed and I DEFINITELY wouldn t have been there encouraging it. As an employee of Tesco and a vegan  I am happy to see more vegan choices for the many thousands and vegans. Though I think there is still more tesco can do. It isn t just about diet but animal welfare and the environmental issues at stake. There is so much animal abuse either at farms  especially intensive farming of livestock and also in slaughter houses. A plant based diet has always  and will always be healthier than a heavy dairy and meat based diet. The obesity crisis can be helped by a plant based diet  not to mention type 2 diabetes  heart disease and many other conditions. The meat and dairy industries are a drain on resources  ie food and water. They are also massively subsidised by the tax payer.  I also know that Quorn are going fully vegan purely by demand  by leaving out egg in the mixture. I have yet to see any in tesco stores. I cannot eat too much soya so I and many others are awaiting these products.

It s been an emotional day moving into what will be our long-term rental house whilst our home is being rebuilt. Our house burnt down on 1st April destroying everything we own.  I went into tesco in havant to get some items we needed for the house and to ask for some hangers as we have none.  The 2 young ladies in the clothing section said not a problem and would get a large box of the for me for free. When they came back with them they brought to senior staff members too. The 2 girls had told them what had happened to our house and said they would sort out the list if items I needed to get and took me to the cafe for a cup of tea.  This was above and beyond anything I could imagine. They were so lovely and caring just as everyone has been since this terrible accident happened. I would like make a complaint about Llandudno Tesco store please (and may possibly be across the board at tesco).  I have complained twice to customer service over 3 mths and to date it remains the same.  I don t eat animals bodies or their by-products. When I go to the vegetarian/vegan freezer section to buy my food   I don t expect to have severed legs and limbs of animals on sale  scattered amongst the food I have to look at and buy!  There is so little on offer that doesn t contained battered  abused broken bodies in the supermarket  and the few things that are actually on offer  I now will refuse to buy from tesco because of their stocking policy.  Tesco seem to think it is some  fad diet  so group it together with  free from anything you can think of  foods  so they put bags of dead chicken nuggets in the section  dead chicken medallions (whatever that is? lets just call it flesh shall we?) etc.  I happened to pick some up thinking I may just get some for the kids  assuming it was vegetarian since IT WAS in the VEGETARIAN section  but was horrified to find it wasn t!  maybe it s someones idea of a sick shelf stocking joke?  I have complained to customer service politely twice over the last 3 months and explained it from our point of view.  To those who eat the flesh of animals  they are desensitised to waht it actually is  so just think we are making a  fuss over nothing .  From the point of view of people who abstain from these foods  we see  when we look in the freezer  not just a misplaced box of food  but infact the broken torn body parts of the most abused kind of animals in the agriciultural industry- A chicken  who is unfortunate enough to live only a short 35 days (instead of 10-20 yrs) and then cruelly slaughtered  all so they can become junk food.  It is highly offensive that Tesco is so inconsiderate in the respect and i am fed up with our supermarket doing nothing about it.  Would you put Pork legs in the Kosher section of a London supermarket? I think probably not.  Please be considerate and make it an across the board stocking policy in EVERY  store   that in at least ONE  area of the supermarket  we are not having abused animals shoved in our face whilst we are trying to shop? Until that time  I have decided that we will no longer be purchasing any products from that section.  Thank you.

I had an absolutely hideous time at our local tesco yesterday (hookwood  horley). We decide to give the scan and pack devise another go  which I was dubious about because the last few times I d been subjected to random checks  and set off. We literally had less than 10 items in our bag and yet we still got a random check!   A young girl by the name of Georgie came over and when I explained to her that this was in fact the 4th time I d been  chosen  for a random check she said that that s what happens for the first 6 times of using the service and that most people actually speak to a member of staff before registering. Well I didn t because there was no need I believed. You literally scan your clubcard  enter your postcode and accept the terms and conditions (which are so tiny on the screen you need a magnifying glass). Anyway after explaining this to Georgie  who by the way hadn t greeted us just literally started pulling all our shopping out of the bag  she got quite flippant and just kept repeating that most people speak to a member of staff and it happens the first 6 times. So I suggested that maybe there should be some kind of sign or something beside the scanners to warn customers of this and still Georgie just repeated herself over and over. By their point my partner and I were getting quite angry because  she just wasn t listening to us and this whole time hadn t even bothered to look at us.   Finally she finished what she had to do  snatched the basket from the stand  turned her back and flounced off! No sorry for the inconvenience  no I ll forward your suggestion literally nothing. She just stomped off like a child. I d had enough so asked her colleague for a manager  who came pretty quickly but was very nervous. I explained what had happened and all he did was repeat what Georgie said about how the system does random checks the first 6 shops lol (not quite random if it s actually going to happen each time). He explained that it was in the T&Cs that you agree to when registering so I again suggested that part be more clearly stated. I said that my real problem wasn t the stupid rules of the scanning it was in fact the rudeness and compete ignorance of his member of staff (who by the was was around the corner crying to a customer who had walked in saying how if been horrible to her) and all he said was he d have a word. He did apologise but it was quite back handed especially when he said that Georgie was only doing her job trying to explain the system.   Honestly Customer Service is not complicated. Speak politely and treat customers who are spending money in your shop with respect. That s what you get paid for. This whole situation has put me off using the scan and pack again. I thought the point was to be able to get in and out quickly but yesterday it took as long to check out with under 10 items than it would if I had a massive trolley full.

Would like to thank the very nice man in Tesco Extra Chesterfield for his help when I had to go to Tesco early hours as we had ran out of baby wipes and have a 4 month old so obviously needed them  I was walking round and came across two men who started harassing me  by the time I got to self service  they had got there too  I paid for my items and had already mentioned to the guy that they had been troubling me I walked off to the escalator and as I was going down the two came up leaning over  the edge looking down my top shouting I can see her boobs etc they ran down after me and tried convincing me to go back with them and started shouting abuse  I had to go back in for something and he approached me making sure I was okay and even approached a police woman stood at the counter paying and explained what had happened to her and even offered to walk me down to make sure they left me alone  he was such a thoughtful and caring man and seemed genuinely concerned  lovely to know that you have genuine people employed who care  he made a bad experience better :)
